availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Milton Jameson Durham (Boyle County, Kentucky, attorney and judge. )

body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky, attorney. Boyle County, Kentucky, native. Son of Benjamin Durham and Margaret Robertson Durham. Married to Martha Jane Mitchell Durham in Boyle County, Kentucky, on June 15, 1850. Father of Louis H. Durham, Benjamin J. Durham, John B. Durham, James W. Durham, Ora Durham, and Robert Durham. Graduate of Asbury University (DePauw University) in Greencastle, Putnam County, Indiana, in 1844. Graduate of University of Louisville Law School in Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Boyle County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Boyle County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Boyle County in 1860. Appointed Circuit Court Judge in 1861.

ab.bibl:
